title: Antony and Cleopatra
full_title: The Tragedy of Antony and Cleopatra

themes.theme_explanation: Antony’s passionate love for Cleopatra conflicts with his duties as a Roman general, leading to his downfall as he prioritizes desire over responsibility.
The play explores power struggles and political maneuvering, as Antony’s alliance with Cleopatra undermines his position against Octavius Caesar’s rising dominance.
Honor shapes Antony’s identity as a warrior, but his love for Cleopatra and eventual defeat challenge his sense of Roman virtue and loyalty.
The cultural clash between Rome’s discipline and Egypt’s sensuality highlights the tension between Antony’s Roman identity and his immersion in Cleopatra’s world.

famous_quotes.quote: Age cannot wither her, nor custom stale her infinite variety.
famous_quotes.speaker: Enobarbus
famous_quotes.explanation: Enobarbus praises Cleopatra's timeless allure, emphasizing her captivating and ever-changing nature that keeps Antony enthralled.

famous_quotes.speaker: Antony
famous_quotes.explanation: As Antony faces death, he addresses Cleopatra as 'Egypt,' reflecting their intertwined identities and his acceptance of their tragic fate.

summary: The Roman general Mark Antony falls in love with Cleopatra, Queen of Egypt. Their relationship threatens his standing in Rome and leads to conflict with Octavius Caesar. Their tragic love story ends in double suicide as they are defeated in battle.
